name: Sodium Chloride
indications: slushed solution used create regional hypothermia order reduce minimize manifestations warm-temperature ischemia . temperature probes may used determine requirements replacement addition slushed solution .
contraindications: volume slushed solution required vary patient ’ age , condition , cooling effect desired duration cooling effect desired , according physician ’ instructions .
warningsAndPrecautions: . 9 % sodium chloride irrigation , usp baxter sterile container system supplied follows : code size ( ml ) ndc din 2b7231 1000 0338-0051-44 786160 exposure pharmaceutical products heat minimized . avoid excessive heat . avoid freezing except controlled slushing procedure . recommended product stored room temperature ( 25ºc ) ; brief exposure 40ºc adversely affect product .
indications_original: Slushed solution is used to create regional hypothermia in order to reduce and minimize manifestations of warm-temperature ischemia. Temperature probes may be used to determine requirements for replacement or addition of slushed solution.
contraindications_original: The volume of slushed solution required will vary with patient’s age, clinical condition, cooling effect desired and duration of cooling effect desired, according to physician’s instructions.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
.9% Sodium Chloride Irrigation, USP in the Baxter Sterile Container System is supplied as follows:

                  Exposure of pharmaceutical products to heat should be minimized. Avoid excessive heat. Avoid freezing except during controlled slushing procedure. It is recommended that this product be stored at room temperature (25ºC); brief exposure up to 40ºC does not adversely affect this product.
